bibl.author: Ellen M. O'Connor
bibl.title: Bethuel Smith to Walt Whitman, 13 October 1863
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

revisionDesc.change: corrected orgName, added pbs, added choice tags

body.p:
I now sit down to write to write you a few lines to let you now where I am I am with the regiment now. I left Carlisle about one week ago and have benbeen diledaleyingdilly-dallying around & have not had time to rite to you untilluntil now & I have not got much time now
the toe is most all healed up but my foot is swelled so that I can not get my boot on it swelled from walking from the depot out her but I think that will go down in a day or to the brigade is gone out to the front again & I dontdon't now but we shall follow them pretty soon I dontdon't now as I can write annyany more at present So good by for this time
